result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob M Kegu was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied to fine and costs, balance to be paid at $100.00 per month commencing 07-01-2016 or serve 37 days jail, consecutive, as penalty for non payment.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Menomonee Falls Police Dept.    Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Huber, with Standard Release Conditions and Medical Appointments.  Sentence to begin FORTHWITH.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Perform alcohol assessment and follow through.
ATTEND Victim Impact Panel on 06-22-2016 or serve 20 days Huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend.
To be completed within 1 year. To be monitored by WCS.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob M Kegu

defendant.name: Kegu, Jacob M

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jacob M Kegu in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Count #2 and 3 are dismissed and read into count #1.    

The defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count #1:

HUBER:  45 days, w/Standard Release Conditions and medical appointments. Defendant is remanded into custody and sentence to begin forthwith.

FINE: $1544.00 (apply cash bail and balaqnce to be paid at  $100.00  per month commencing 7/1/16 or serve 37 days jail, consecutive, as penalty for non payment of fine);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00, to be paid at $100.00 per month consecutive to payment of fine. Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $60.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to Menomonee Falls Police Department (to be paid as part of payment plan on fine/costs.)

COMMUNITY SERVICE: 75 Hours to be completed within 1 year and to be monitored by WCS.

D/L REVOCATION: 24 months;

IGNITION INTERLOCK: 24 months;

Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel on:  6/22/16. Defendant to serve 20 days huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel.

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.

  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
From Atty Rothstein dated 4/15/16 with attached character letter.
From State dated 3/21/16 re State will request adjournment at status if case doesn't settle.

Defendant Jacob M Kegu in court with attorney Gregory Rothstein for Michael Edward Banaszak.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court addresses the positive WCS report.  Attorney Rothstein advises he has received discovery but is still waiting for the lab test results.  The Court sets the matter for trial.  Jury status hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Apply cash posted.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program. (posted at V/Meno Falls-to be forwarded)

Defendant Jacob M Kegu in court with attorney Michael Edward Banaszak.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for January 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
